info.name: Filament One API
info.description:
This Postman API Collection provides a comprehensive set of requests for interacting with **Filament One**, a powerful admin panel framework built on Laravel. The collection includes endpoints for authentication, resource management, user permissions, and other core functionalities, making it easier to test and integrate Filament One into your applications.

**Features:**

âœ… Pre-configured request examples for quick testing  
âœ… Environment variables for seamless API configuration  
âœ… Structured folders for easy navigation  
âœ… Ready-to-use authentication workflows

Use this collection to streamline your API development process and efficiently manage your Filament One-based applications.

item.name: Authentication

formdata.description: The email address of the user.
The password for the user's account.

request.description:
**API Request Description**

This endpoint allows users to log in by providing their email and password in the request body.

**Request**

- Form Data:
    
    - `email` (text): The email address of the user.
        
    - `password` (text): The password for the user's account.
        

**Response**

The response for this request follows the JSON schema below:

``` json
{
  "success": "boolean",
  "message": "string",
  "token": "string"
}

 ```

The response contains the `token` which is a string representing the authentication token.

**API Request Description**

This endpoint is used to log out the authenticated user by revoking the access token.

**Response**

The response for this request follows the JSON schema below:

``` json
{
  "success": "boolean",
  "message": "string"
}

 ```

The response will contain a "success" boolean indicating the status of the logout operation, and a "message" string which may provide additional information.

**API Request Description**

This endpoint is used to get the details of the authenticated user.

**Response**

The response for this request follows the JSON schema below:

``` json
{
  "id": "integer",
  "name": "string",
  "email": "string",
  "email_verified_at": "timestamp",
  "created_at": "timestamp",
  "updated_at": "timestamp",
  "deleted_at": "timestamp",
  "user_profile": {
    "id": "integer",
    "user_id": "integer",
    "phone": "string",
    "birthdate": "date",
    "created_at": "timestamp",
    "updated_at": "timestamp",
    "deleted_at": "timestamp"
  }
}

 ```

The response will contain a "success" boolean indicating the status of the logout operation, and a "message" string which may provide additional information.

item.description:
TheÂ **Authentication**Â folder contains essential API requests for managing user authentication inÂ **Filament One**. This includes endpoints for user login, registration, and logout, enabling secure access control within your application.

**Endpoints Included:**

ðŸ”¹Â **Login**Â â€“ Authenticate users and retrieve an access token.  
ðŸ”¹Â **Register**Â â€“ Create a new user account.  
ðŸ”¹Â **Logout**Â â€“ Revoke the user's access token and end the session.

These endpoints help ensure secure authentication and user session management in your Filament One-powered applications. ðŸš€

item.name: CMS
Page Builder

query.description: The page number for paginating the results.
The number of items to be included per page.

request.description:
**API Request Description**

This endpoint retrieves a list of page builders with the option to paginate the results.

**Request**

- Query Parameters:
    
    - `page` (number, required): The page number for paginating the results.
        
    - `per_page` (number, required): The number of items to be included per page.
        

**Response**

The response for this request follows the JSON schema below:

``` json
{
  "data": [
    {
      "id": "integer",
      "title": "string",
      "slug": "string",
      "description": "string",
      "is_active": "boolean",
      "content": "string",
      "custom_css": "string",
      "custom_js": "string",
      "meta": {
        "author": "string",
        "keywords": "string",
        "description": "string"
      },
      "created_at": "timestamp",
      "updated_at": "timestamp",
      "deleted_at": "timestamp"
    }
  ],
  "links": {
    "first": "string",
    "last": "string",
    "prev": "string",
    "next": "string"
  },
  "meta": {
    "current_page": "integer",
    "from": "integer",
    "last_page": "integer",
    "links": [
      {
        "url": "string",
        "label": "string",
        "active": "boolean"
      }
    ],
    "path": "string",
    "per_page": "integer",
    "to": "integer",
    "total": "integer"
  }
}

 ```

variable.description: The unique id of the page builder object.

request.description:
**API Request Description**

The endpoint retrieves the details of a specific page builder identified by the provided ID.

**Request**

- Path Variables:
    
    - `:id` (number, required): The unique id of the page builder object.
        

**Response**

The response for this request follows the JSON schema below:

``` json
{
  "data": {
    "id": "integer",
    "title": "string",
    "slug": "string",
    "description": "string",
    "is_active": "boolean",
    "content": "string",
    "custom_css": "string",
    "custom_js": "string",
    "meta": {
      "author": "string",
      "keywords": "string",
      "description": "string"
    },
    "created_at": "timestamp",
    "updated_at": "timestamp",
    "deleted_at": "timestamp"
  }
}

 ```

formdata.description: The title of the page builder.
The slug of the page builder.
The description of the page builder.
Indicates whether the page builder is active.
The content of the page builder.
Custom CSS for the page builder.
Custom JavaScript for the page builder.
The author metadata for the page builder
The keywords metadata for the page builder.
The description metadata for the page builder.

request.description:
**API Request Description**

This endpoint allows the admin to add a new page builder.

**Request**

- Form Data:
    
    - `title` (text, required): The title of the page builder.
        
    - `slug` (text, required): The slug of the page builder.
        
    - `description` (text): The description of the page builder.
        
    - `is_active` (boolean, required): Indicates whether the page builder is active.
        
    - `content` (text): The content of the page builder.
        
    - `custom_css` (text): Custom CSS for the page builder.
        
    - `custom_js` (text): Custom JavaScript for the page builder.
        
    - `meta[author]` (text): The author metadata for the page builder.
        
    - `meta[keywords]` (text): The keywords metadata for the page builder.
        
    - `meta[description]` (text): The description metadata for the page builder.
        

**Response**

The response for this request follows the JSON schema below:

``` json
{
  "message": "string"
  "data": {
    "id": "integer",
    "title": "string",
    "slug": "string",
    "description": "string",
    "is_active": "boolean",
    "content": "string",
    "custom_css": "string",
    "custom_js": "string",
    "meta": {
      "author": "string",
      "keywords": "string",
      "description": "string"
    },
    "created_at": "timestamp",
    "updated_at": "timestamp"
  }
}

 ```

formdata.description: The title of the page builder.
The slug of the page builder.
The description of the page builder.
Indicates whether the page builder is active.
The content of the page builder.
Custom CSS for the page builder.
Custom JavaScript for the page builder.
The author metadata for the page builder
The keywords metadata for the page builder.
The description metadata for the page builder.

variable.description: The unique id of the page builder object.

request.description:
**API Request Description**

This endpoint allows the admin to update a page builder object.

**Request**

- Path Variables:
    
    - `:id` (number, required): The unique id of the page builder object.
        
- Form Data:
    
    - `title` (text, required): The title of the page builder.
        
    - `slug` (text, required): The slug of the page builder.
        
    - `description` (text): The description of the page builder.
        
    - `is_active` (boolean, required): Indicates whether the page builder is active.
        
    - `content` (text): The content of the page builder.
        
    - `custom_css` (text): Custom CSS for the page builder.
        
    - `custom_js` (text): Custom JavaScript for the page builder.
        
    - `meta[author]` (text): The author metadata for the page builder.
        
    - `meta[keywords]` (text): The keywords metadata for the page builder.
        
    - `meta[description]` (text): The description metadata for the page builder.
        

**Response**

The response for this request follows the JSON schema below:

``` json
{
  "message": "string"
  "data": {
    "id": "integer",
    "title": "string",
    "slug": "string",
    "description": "string",
    "is_active": "boolean",
    "content": "string",
    "custom_css": "string",
    "custom_js": "string",
    "meta": {
      "author": "string",
      "keywords": "string",
      "description": "string"
    },
    "created_at": "timestamp",
    "updated_at": "timestamp",
    "deleted_at": "timestamp"
  }
}

 ```

variable.description: The unique id of the page builder object.

request.description:
**API Request Description**

The endpoint deletes a specific page builder identified by the provided ID.

**Request**

- Path Variables:
    
    - `:id` (number, required): The unique id of the page builder object.
        

**Response**

``` json
    "slug": "string",

    "is_active": "boolean",
    "content": "string",
    "custom_css": "string",
    "custom_js": "string",
    "meta": {
      "author": "string",
      "keywords": "string",
      "description": "string"
    },
    "created_at": "timestamp",
    "updated_at": "timestamp",
    "deleted_at": "timestamp"
  }
}

 ```

Note: Deleted page builder object can be restored using the `Restore API`

variable.description: The unique id of the page builder object.

request.description:
**API Request Description**

The endpoint restores a deleted page builder identified by the provided ID.

**Request**

- Path Variables:
    
    - `:id` (number, required): The unique id of the page builder object.
        

**Response**

The response for this request follows the JSON schema below:

``` json
{
  "message": "string",
  "data": {
    "id": "integer",

    "slug": "string",
    "description": "string",
    "is_active": "boolean",
    "content": "string",
    "custom_css": "string",
    "custom_js": "string",
    "meta": {
      "author": "string",
      "keywords": "string",
      "description": "string"
    },
    "created_at": "timestamp",
    "updated_at": "timestamp",
    "deleted_at": "timestamp"
  }
}

 ```

Note: Only soft deleted page builder objects can be restored using the `Restore API`

item.description:
TheÂ **Page Builder Module**Â folder contains API requests for managing theÂ **Filament One Page Builder**, a powerful tool for creating and customizing dynamic pages. This module allows users to design pages with structured components, ensuring flexibility and ease of content management.

**Endpoints Included:**

ðŸ”¹Â **Create Block**Â â€“ Add a new content block to a page.  
ðŸ”¹Â **Update Block**Â â€“ Modify the content and settings of an existing block.  
ðŸ”¹Â **Delete Block**Â â€“ Remove a content block from a page.  
ðŸ”¹Â **Get Page Structure**Â â€“ Retrieve the full structure and content of a page.

These endpoints provide complete control over the page-building process, making it easy to create and manage structured content withinÂ **Filament One**. ðŸš€

TheÂ **CMS**Â folder contains API requests for managing content withinÂ **Filament Oneâ€™s**Â Page Builder module. This module enables dynamic content creation and customization, allowing users to build and manage pages effortlessly.

**Endpoints Included:**

ðŸ”¹Â **Create Page**Â â€“ Add a new page with customizable content.  
ðŸ”¹Â **Update Page**Â â€“ Modify existing page content and settings.  
ðŸ”¹Â **Delete Page**Â â€“ Remove a page from the CMS.  
ðŸ”¹Â **Get Pages**Â â€“ Retrieve a list of all created pages.

Use these endpoints to integrate and manage your content efficiently within the Filament One ecosystem. ðŸš€

request.description:
**API Request Description**

This endpoint retrieves a list of users with the option to paginate the results.

**Request**

- Query Parameters:
    
    - `page` (number, required): The page number for paginating the results.
        
    - `per_page` (number, required): The number of items to be included per page.
        

**Response**

The response for this request follows the JSON schema below:

``` json
{
  "data": [
    {
      "id": "integer",
      "name": "string",
      "email": "string",
      "email_verified_at": "timestamp",
      "created_at": "timestamp",
      "updated_at": "timestamp",
      "deleted_at": "timestamp",
      "user_profile": {
        "id": "integer",
        "user_id": "integer",
        "phone": "string",
        "birthdate": "date",
        "created_at": "timestamp",
        "updated_at": "timestamp",
        "deleted_at": "timestamp"
      }
    }
  ],
  "links": {
    "first": "string",
    "last": "string",
    "prev": "string",
    "next": "string"
  },
  "meta": {
    "current_page": "integer",
    "from": "integer",
    "last_page": "integer",
    "links": [
      {
        "url": "string",
        "label": "string",
        "active": "boolean"
      }
    ],
    "path": "string",
    "per_page": "integer",
    "to": "integer",
    "total": "integer"
  }
}

 ```

formdata.description: The full name of the user.
The email address of the user.
The password of the user.
The password confirmation of the user.
The phone number of the user.
The birthdate of the user.
The roles of the user.
The photo of the user.

request.description:
**API Request Description**

This endpoint allows the admin to add a new user.

**Request**

- Form Data:
    
    - `name` (text, required): The full name of the user.
        
    - `email` (text, required): The email address of the user.
        
    - `password` (text, required): The password of the user.
        
    - `password_confirmation` (text, required): The password confirmation of the user.
        
    - `phone` (text): The phone number of the user.
        
    - `birthdate` (date): The birthdate of the user.
        
    - `roles` (array): The roles of the user.
        
    - `avatar` (file): The photo of the user.
        

**Response**

The response for this request follows the JSON schema below:

``` json
{
  "message": "string"
  "data": {
    "id": "integer",
    "name": "string",
    "email": "string",
    "email_verified_at": "timestamp",
    "created_at": "timestamp",
    "updated_at": "timestamp",
    "deleted_at": "timestamp",
    "user_profile": {
      "id": "integer",
      "user_id": "integer",
      "phone": "string",
      "birthdate": "date",
      "created_at": "timestamp",
      "updated_at": "timestamp",
      "deleted_at": "timestamp"
    }
  }
}

 ```

formdata.description: The full name of the user.
The email address of the user.
The password of the user.
The password confirmation of the user.
The phone number of the user.
The birthdate of the user.

The photo of the user.

formdata.description: The name of the api credentials.
The slug of the api credentials.
Indicates whether the api credentials is active.
The collection of keys, secrets or passwords of the api credentials.

request.description:
**API Request Description**

This endpoint allows the admin to add api credentials.

**Request**

- Form Data:
    
    - `name` (text, required): The name of the api credentials.
        
    - `slug` (text, required): The slug of the api credentials.
        
    - `is_active` (boolean, required): Indicates whether the api credentials is active.
        
    - `keys` (array, required): The collection of keys, secrets or passwords of the api credentials.
        

**Response**

The response for this request follows the JSON schema below:

``` json
{
  "message": "string"
  "data": {
    "id": "integer",
    "name": "string",
    "slug": "string",
    "is_active": "boolean",
    "keys": "array",
    "created_at": "timestamp",
    "updated_at": "timestamp",
    "deleted_at": "timestamp"
  }
}

 ```

``` json

    "name": "string",
    "slug": "string",
    "is_active": "boolean",
    "keys": "array",
    "created_at": "timestamp",
    "updated_at": "timestamp",
    "deleted_at": "timestamp"
  }
}

 ```

``` json
    "is_active": "boolean",
    "keys": "array",
    "created_at": "timestamp",
    "updated_at": "timestamp",
    "deleted_at": "timestamp"
  }
}
 ```

variable.description: The unique id of the api credentials object.

request.description:
**API Request Description**

The endpoint restores a deleted api credentials identified by the provided ID.

**Request**

- Path Variables:
    
    - `:id` (number, required): The unique id of the api credentials object.
        

**Response**

The response for this request follows the JSON schema below:

``` json
{
  "message": "string",
  "data": {
    "id": "integer",
    "name": "string",
    "slug": "string",
    "is_active": "boolean",
    "keys": "array",
    "created_at": "timestamp",
    "updated_at": "timestamp",
    "deleted_at": "timestamp"
  }
}

 ```

Note: Only soft deleted api credentials can be restored using the `Restore API`
